Tavatron growled deeply. Tigerhawk, whether intentionally or not, had 
just put all their lives on the line. Right about now she'd feel alot 
safer facing a fleet of Preds than hanging here, helpless, with 
Tigerhawk threatening to blow up the ship. 

Tavatron followed Tigerhawk's movements with her eyes. She cringed 
slightly as he detonated the grenade, expecting a blinding flash and 
sudden death. Instead all that followed was a sudden flash of light, 
causing her to cry out in surprise as she shut her eyes against the 
blinding light. Her wolfen eyes were quite sensitive to sudden
changes 
in light and dark, but this was too much. She slowly opened her 
optics, expecting to see small colorful dots, much like after a
camera 
flash:

"Oh slag..."

Tavatron whispered softly. This was even worse. Tavarton's eyes
darted 
about the room, searching, hoping for any sign of color, of light. 
Instead all she saw were dark shadows against an even darker
backdrop. 
The grenade had blinded her. The blast, coupled with her injuries 
from the earlier battle, had destroyed what was left of her sight. It 
was nothing a CR chamber couldn't fix, but unfortunetly she didn't 
have access to one.
